# Python Rules

## Linting & Formatting
- All code must pass `ruff check` with project configuration
- All code must be formatted with `black`
- Run `ruff check --fix` and `black .` before committing

## Type Safety
- All public functions and methods must have type hints (PEP 484)
- Use `typing.Protocol` for structural subtyping
- Run `mypy --strict` for new modules

## Code Style
- Follow PEP 8 style guide
- Use dataclasses or Pydantic models for structured data
- Isolate IO operations at module boundaries
- Core logic must be pure and testable without mocking IO

## Testing
- Use pytest for all testing
- Test files must mirror source structure (tests/test_*.py)
- Use pytest fixtures for setup and parameterize for variants
- Coverage must not decrease from the current baseline

## Documentation
- Google-style docstrings for all public modules, classes, and functions
- Include Args, Returns, and Raises sections where applicable
